video_description:
A review of the Acer Iconia Tab A500. Overall, it's a very nice tablet with a great range of connectivity options including host USB, and mini HDMI. Android Honeycomb 3.0 comes by default, but and update to 3.2 is available. Battery life is admirable, and build quality is surprisingly good, if a bit weightier than the iPad 2 and Mototrola Xoom. 

Definitely recommended for its relatively low price point, and it's a worthy netbook replacement if you don't need too much storage.

More Android and Linux vids on the way!
title: ACER ICONIA TAB A500 REVIEW | IGO | DEC 5
